definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: Of course, I've booked the train tickets now. And Tom's looking forward to it.
sentences.chinese: 当然了，我已经订了火车票了，而且汤姆也很期待。

sentences.english: I got a second-class ticket on the train to New York.
sentences.chinese: 我弄到一张去纽约的二等舱火车票。

sentences.english: I got a second-class ticket on the train to Paris.
sentences.chinese: 我有张去巴黎的二等火车票。

sentences.english: Each survivor got $25 and a train ticket.
sentences.chinese: 每位幸存者获得25美元补偿和一张火车票。

sentences.english: Hotels can provide typing, photocopying , fax, air tickets, train tickets.
sentences.chinese: 酒店可提供打字，复印，传真，飞机票，火车票。

sentences.english: A lot of train tickets are bought by scalpers.
sentences.chinese: 黄牛掌握了大量的火车票源。

sentences.english: Passengers could only book real name tickets by phone before Monday.
sentences.chinese: 在周一前，乘客只能通过点火预订实名制火车票。

sentences.english: Air or train tickets to Heilongjiang are in huge demand.
sentences.chinese: 目前，前往黑龙江的机票或火车票都很紧俏。

sentences.english: The station began to sell the first batch of train tickets for the Spring Festival travel period on the day.
sentences.chinese: 该火车站当天开始出售春运期间的第一批火车票。

sentences.english: Can you help me buy a train ticket to Taichung?
sentences.chinese: 你能不能帮我买一张到台中的火车票？

sentences.english: You can't go into the waiting room without a train ticket.
sentences.chinese: 你没有火车票，不能进入候车室。

sentences.english: The train ticket prices will not be raised during the Spring Festival period this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年春节期间火车票票价不上涨。

sentences.english: Can you tell me the price of one ticket to Pingxiang?
sentences.chinese: 请问去凭祥的火车票价钱是多少？

sentences.english: Oh, I know. But where is my railway ticket?!
sentences.chinese: 噢，我知道。但是我的火车票跑哪去啦？

sentences.english: B: Yes, could you help me get a train ticket?
sentences.chinese: 有，你能帮我买一张火车票吗？

definition: to buy tickets/(Tw) to buy votes (in an election)
to bounce (a check)/to return a ticket/ticket refund
(increased) passenger transportation around Chinese New Year
to change one's reservation/to transfer to a different flight, airline, bus or train
power car/multiple-unit train (abbr. for 動車組|动车组)
to buy or upgrade a ticket after boarding a train, boat etc/to buy a ticket for a show after having sat down in the theater
train or coach service ("service" as in "they run 12 services per day between the two cities")
